urls.title: Environmental breaches soar as prosecutions collapse
urls.description: There has been a sharp rise in serious breaches of environmental rules designed to protect people and wildlife from pollution, analysis by The Times has found.The breaches of Environment Agency (EA)

text: @CossieRob @EnvAgency Not am I. I’m talking broadly about unreliable data being used to justify the levels of restrictions being imposed. For something as serious as this you’d want solid data surely?
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency I’m saying sewage sampling results aren’t leading the way.
@CossieRob @EnvAgency So you’re saying the government’s policies aren’t being lead by the data they receive?
@WandleForum @thameswater @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @LDNWaterkeeper I'm assuming someone had contacted the @EnvAgency ??
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Supporting, not directing or leading.

@CossieRob @EnvAgency It’s literally in the title of the article? The government will use that information to justify their policies. Where we are today is based on unreliable data. So I feel testing a large catchment area of human waste will not improve the situation.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Who is using sewage sampling results to lock people down. Show me one example.

@CossieRob @EnvAgency My first comment was about the justification of locking healthy people up, now whether it’s your shit or you snot that they test, it shouldn’t be used to lock healthy people up if the testing isn’t reliable.
RT @Feargal_Sharkey: For how much longer is this going to be tolerated? The @EnvAgency had failed, the board has failed, the management hav…

@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Maybe so but you’re commenting on a thread from the Environment Agency talking about sewage.

@CossieRob @EnvAgency I’m not talking about sewage testing. I’m talking about the current PCR test with a reliability that is laughable being used to justify locking people up. That’s why we’re seeing so many people testing positive who don’t have any symptoms. PCR tests for damaged RNA not viral load
